body_html:
@Jensen-Su Sorry about the tracing being polluted by the final RunTimeError. Your real issue is that EINTR interrupts queue.get. Python doesn't handle this until 3.5. I'll send out a PR to address these two things.

@lysuhin Your issue is unrelated to the above one. What did you do in your dataset's __getitem__? Also, as asked by @apaszke , what's your CPU?
body_text:
@Jensen-Su Sorry about the tracing being polluted by the final RunTimeError. Your real issue is that EINTR interrupts queue.get. Python doesn't handle this until 3.5. I'll send out a PR to address these two things.

body:
@Jensen-Su Sorry about the tracing being polluted by the final RunTimeError. Your real issue is that EINTR interrupts `queue.get`. Python doesn't handle this until 3.5. I'll send out a PR to address these two things.

@lysuhin Your issue is unrelated to the above one. What did you do in your dataset's `__getitem__`? Also, as asked by @apaszke , what's your CPU?
